> From: Jeff.Langr@... [mailto:Jeff.Langr@...]
> 
> Fro=
m: Jim Dixon <jdd@...>
> > However, you should NEVER put an assertio=
n in setUp().  

I disagree on the grounds that the assert*() methods are j=
ust executed as regular methods.  By which I mean they have no part in the =
JUnit TestCase life cycle or contractual relationship with the test runner.=
  They don't fire events and they don't get invoked via reflection like tes=
t*() methods do.  They're just methods for asserting boolean conditions.  A=
s such, I think they can be useful in setUp() or tearDown() as long as they=
're used in the general assertion capability way that Jeff seems to be usin=
g them.

I guess it would follow from my argument that if one is using JDK =
1.4 APIs, one could just as well use the assert keyword where he's using JU=
nit assert() methods in setUp() and tearDown().  Eh?  Never thought of that=
 before.

Best,
Scott Stirling
Workscape, Inc.
